III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It was alleged that Youth A experienced sexual abuse while
placed at the facility.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 12/20/2024 and had no
additional information to provide.
During an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
12/16/2024 DHHS Worker 1 reported Youth A had been
interviewed on 12/11/2024 about the original allegations. He
stated his words had been taken out of context and that he never
was the victim of sexual abuse on the part of staff at the facility
when he was placed there. Youth A alleged Staff 1 had physically
abused him while attempting to restrain Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 01/30/2025. He
referred to past comments about staff at the facility “messing” with
him as referring to physical contact. Youth A denied experiencing
any kind of sexual assault during his placement at the facility.
Administrator 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/16/2024 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She reported the facility had no records of any sexual
victimization of Youth A during his time placed at the facility.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed there was no evidence
found that Youth A was sexually abused while placed at the
facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
2

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 physically abused Youth A during his time placed at the
facility.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 12/20/2024 and had no
additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone on 01/30/2025. He
referred to past comments about staff at the facility “messing” with
him as referring to physical contact. Youth A recalled one
instance where he believed Staff 1 hit him when Youth A did not
listen to Staff 1. Youth A described an instance when he was in
his bedroom and Staff 1 was outside of Youth A’s open bedroom
door. He stated Staff 1 hit him twice while inside of the
bedroom. Youth A further clarified Staff 1 had originally come to
Youth A’s bedroom because Youth A had separated himself from
the rest of the unit, who were all in a separate common
area. Staff 1 stated to Youth A “Come on bro, come back to the
lounge.” Youth A recalled being upset and running past Staff 1 to
AWOL from the facility. Youth A described Staff 1’s stance as
bumping shoulders with Youth A as Youth A moved past
him. Youth A believed Staff 1 held his hand out and this also
made contact with Youth A as this occurred. Youth A reiterated
that this occurred directly inside of his doorway of his
bedroom. Youth A could not provide any other details about this
incident other than the likelihood that it occurred on a weekday
and in the afternoon while youth were not in school. Youth A also
confirmed he had never been restrained at the facility and did not
have concerns about physical contact with any other staff while
placed there.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/16/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility and over
the phone on 02/24/24/2025. Staff 1 did not believe Youth A had
ever been restrained during his time placed at the facility. Staff 1
could not recall any times when he made physical contact with
Youth A and denied ever seeing or hearing about anyone else
3

hitting Youth A in any form. He described a difficult relationship
working with Youth A because of Youth A’s frequent tendency to
escalate emotionally and “storm” out of the building to AWOL.
Staff 1 could not recall an instance when he had physical contact
with Youth A near Youth A’s bedroom preceding an AWOL
attempt. He noted that staff are trained not to put themselves in a
position where they would be separated from the group and in a
one-on-one situation with a youth in their bedroom. If that had
occurred Staff 1 remarked that he would have asked for another
staff to come with him or watch his interaction with the youth. He
also noted a policy for staff within the program to not block exit
ways to thwart an AWOL. Staff 1 reiterated that there were no
times when he had any physical contact with Youth A while Youth
A was placed at the facility.
Administrator 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/16/2024 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She confirmed Youth A had never been restrained while
placed at the facility. She also stated the facility had no records of
any other physical incidents involving Youth A in any form.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/16/2024 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Supervisor 1 described Youth A’s increased AWOL
behaviors as of the date of the interview. Despite those incidents
she did not believe he had ever been restrained and was not
aware of any physical incidents involving Youth A.
Documentation reviewed:
• Through email communication on 01/06/2025 the facility
confirmed that there were no incident reports of physical
management involving Youth A, as well as no grievances
filed by Youth A. They confirmed he had been discharged
from placement at the facility on 12/22/2024.
• Four incident reports regarding Youth A and Staff 1 during
his time placed at the facility were reviewed. None of these
incident reports matched the interaction described by Youth
A in his interview, and none of them provided any cause for
concern.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed there was no evidence
found that Youth A was physically abused while placed at the
facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
